intro: Argocoffeopsis jasminoides, commonly known as the jasmine coffee plant, is a flowering shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its fragrant white flowers and glossy green leaves. It produces small, red berries that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value and aromatic properties, it is often cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine.
